gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Class Kinematics

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.larcfm.Util.Kinematics

  • public final class Kinematics
extends java.lang.Object
    A library of functions to aid the computation of the kinematics of an aircraft. This library is currently under development and is far from complete. The majority of the functions handle constant velocity turns and movement with constant ground speed acceleration.

    Unless otherwise noted, all kinematics function parameters are in internal units -- angles are in radians, linear speeds are in m/s, distances are in meters, time is in seconds.

    • Method Detail

      • turnRadius

        public static double turnRadius(double speed,
                                double bank,
                                double g)
        Calculates turn radius from ground speed and bank angle.
        Parameters:
        speed - ground speed
        bank - bank angle (positive is clockwise looking out the nose of the aircraft), must be in (-pi/2,pi/2).
        g - local gravitational acceleration (must be positive)
        Returns:
        radius (always non-negative)

      • turnRadius

        public static double turnRadius(double speed,
                                double bankAngle)
        Calculates turn radius from ground speed and bank angle. The function assumes standard sea-level gravity, see Units.gn.
        Parameters:
        speed - ground speed
        bankAngle - bank angle (positive is clockwise looking out the nose of the aircraft), must be in (-pi/2,pi/2).
        Returns:
        radius (always non-negative)

      • turnRadiusByRate

        public static double turnRadiusByRate(double speed,
                                      double omega)

      • speedOfTurn

        public static double speedOfTurn(double R,
                                 double bank)
        Calculates ground speed of the vehicle from radius R and the bank angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
        Parameters:
        R - radius, must be non-negative
        bank - bank angle, must be in (-pi/2,pi/2)
        Returns:
        speed

      • turnRateRadius

        public static double turnRateRadius(double speed,
                                    double R)
        Calculates track rate (angular velocity) from ground speed and radius. Negative radius (or speed) will produce a negative result.

        WARNING: this does not return the sign of the turn!!!!

        Parameters:
        speed - ground speed
        R - radius
        Returns:
        turn rate (ie. omega or track rate), positive turn rate is right hand turn.

      • turnRate

        public static double turnRate(double speed,
                              double bankAngle)
        Calculates turn rate (or track-rate) from ground speed and bank angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
        Parameters:
        speed - ground speed
        bankAngle - bank angle, must be in (-pi/2,pi/2)
        Returns:
        turn rate (ie. omega or track rate), positive turn rate is right hand turn.

      • bankAngleRadius

        public static double bankAngleRadius(double speed,
                                     double R)
        Calculates the bank angle used for a given turn radius and ground speed. This function does not have enough information to provide the sign of the bank angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
        Parameters:
        speed - ground speed (speed ≥ 0.0)
        R - radius (R > 0.0)
        Returns:
        bank angle (positive)

      • bankAngleRadius

        public static double bankAngleRadius(double speed,
                                     double R,
                                     boolean turnRight)
        Calculates the bank angle used for a given turn radius and ground speed. Assumes sea-level gravity.
        Parameters:
        speed - ground speed (speed ≥ 0.0)
        R - radius (R > 0.0)
        turnRight - true, if a right turn is desired
        Returns:
        bank angle (positive = turn right, negative = turn left)

      • bankAngleGoal

        public static double bankAngleGoal(double track,
                                   double goalTrack,
                                   double maxBank)
        Find the minimum turn for the to reach the goal and returns the maxBank angle, with the correct sign to achieve that goal. Assumes sea-level gravity.
        Parameters:
        track - the current track
        goalTrack - the goal track angle
        maxBank - the maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2)
        Returns:
        bank angle (positive = turn right, negative = turn left)

      • bankAngle

        public static double bankAngle(double speed,
                               double turnRate)
        Returns the calculated bank angle for a turn that has specified turnRate. Assumes sea-level gravity.
        Parameters:
        speed - ground speed (speed ≥ 0.0)
        turnRate - (positive is a right turn)
        Returns:
        bank angle (positive = turn right, negative = turn left)

      • turnRateGoal

        public static double turnRateGoal(Velocity vo,
                                  double goalTrack,
                                  double maxBank)
        Calculates turn rate (or track-rate) for the minimum turn to the goal track angle. Assumes sea-level gravity.
        Parameters:
        vo - the initial velocity
        goalTrack - the goal track angle
        maxBank - the maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2)
        Returns:
        turn rate (ie. omega or track rate), positive turn rate is right hand turn.

      • turnDone

        public static boolean turnDone(double currentTrack,
                               double targetTrack,
                               boolean turnRight)
        Has the turn completed? Specifically, is the currentTrack at least the targetTrack given that currentTrack is roughly moving in the direction indicated by the parameter turnRight.
        Parameters:
        currentTrack - initial track angle (radians clockwise from true north)
        targetTrack - target track angle
        turnRight - true iff only turn direction is to the right
        Returns:
        true iff turn has passed Target

      • turnTime

        public static double turnTime(Velocity v0,
                              double goalTrack,
                              double maxBank,
                              boolean turnRight)
        Returns the time it takes to achieve the goal track angle
        Parameters:
        v0 - initial velocity vector
        goalTrack - target velocity track [rad]
        maxBank - maximum bank angle, must be in (0,pi/2) [rad]
        turnRight - true iff only turn direction is to the right
        Returns:
        time to achieve turn

      • turnTime

        public static double turnTime(double groundSpeed,
                              double deltaTrack,
                              double bankAngle)
        Returns the time it takes to turn the given angle (deltaTrack). Depending on the signs of deltaTrack and bankAngle, this turn can be more than 180 degrees.
        Parameters:
        groundSpeed - ground speed of aircraft
        deltaTrack - given angle of turn [rad]
        bankAngle - bank angle (-pi/2,pi/2) [rad]
        Returns:
        time to achieve turn

        public static boolean turnRight(Velocity vo,
                                double goalTrack)
        Returns true if the minimal (i.e. less than 180 deg) turn to goalTrack is to the right
        Parameters:
        vo - initial velocity vector
        goalTrack - target velocity track [rad]
        Returns:
        true, if a right turn

                                             double t,
                                             double goalTrack,
                                             double maxBank)

        Parameters:

        vo - initial velocity

      • turnUntil

        public static Pair<Vect3,Velocity> turnUntil(Pair<Vect3,Velocity> svo,
                                             double t,
                                             double goalTrack,
                                             double maxBank)
        Position/Velocity after t time units turning in minimal direction until goalTrack is reached, after that continue in a straight line. The the time t is not long enough to complete the turn, then a position/velocity towards the goal track is returned.
        Parameters:
        svo - starting position and velocity
        t - maneuver time [s]
        goalTrack - the track angle where the turn stops
        maxBank - the maximum bank angle of the aircraft, must be in (0,pi/2)
        Returns:
        Position and Velocity after time t

      • closestTimeOnTurn

        public static double closestTimeOnTurn(Vect3 s0,
                                       Velocity v0,
                                       double omega,
                                       Vect3 x,
                                       double endTime)
        Calculate when during the turn we will be closest to the given point.
        Parameters:
        s0 - turn start position
        v0 - turn start velocity
        omega - rate of turn (+ = right, - = left)
        x - point of interest
        endTime - time at which turn finishes. If <= 0, assume a full turn is allowed.
        Returns:
        time on turn when we are closest to the given point x (in seconds), or -1 if we are precisely at the turn's center This will be bounded by [0,endTime]

      • closestDistOnTurn

        public static double closestDistOnTurn(Vect3 s0,
                                       Velocity v0,
                                       double R,
                                       int dir,
                                       Vect3 x,
                                       double maxDist)
        Calculate when during the turn we will be closest to the given point.
        Parameters:
        s0 - turn start position
        v0 - turn start velocity
        R - turn radius
        dir - direction of turn
        x - point of interest
        maxDist - distance at which turn finishes. If <= 0, assume a full turn is allowed.
        Returns:
        distance on turn when we are closest to the given point x, or -1 if we are precisely at the turn's center This will be bounded by [0,maxDist]

      • turnTimeWithRoll

        public static Pair<Vect3,Velocity> turnTimeWithRoll(Vect3 so,
                                                    Velocity vo,
                                                    double t,
                                                    double turnTime,
                                                    double maxBank,
                                                    boolean turnRight,
                                                    double rollTime)
        EXPERIMENTAL Iterative kinematic turn with a roll rate, starting at bank angle of 0, up to a maximum bank angle.
        Parameters:
        so - initial position
        vo - initial velocity
        t - time point of interest
        turnTime - total time for this turn (sec) (cannot exceed time to perform 360 deg turn)
        turnRight - turn right (true)
        maxBank - maximum allowable bank angle for this turn (rad)
        rollTime - time required for aircraft to roll to the maxBank angle
        Returns:
        return pair of new position, new velocity at end of turn

      • gsAccelToRTA

        public static Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> gsAccelToRTA(double gsIn,
                                                                   double dist,
                                                                   double rta,
                                                                   double gsAccel)
        Compute the goal ground speed and time needed to accelerate in order to reach a point at a given required time of arrival
        Parameters:
        gsIn - Current ground speed (m/s)
        dist - Current horizontal distance to goal point (m)
        rta - (relative) required time of arrival (s)
        gsAccel - maximum ground speed acceleration or deceleration (positive, m/s^2)
        Returns:
        (gs,time) the goal ground speed and acceleration time needed in order to cover the given distance in the given time. The time will be negative if the rta is not attainable.

      • gsAccelToRTA_AD

        public static Pair<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> gsAccelToRTA_AD(double gsIn,
                                                                      double dist,
                                                                      double rta,
                                                                      double gsAccel)
        Compute the goal ground speed and time needed to accelerate in order to reach a point at a given required time of arrival
        Parameters:
        gsIn - Current ground speed (m/s)
        dist - Current horizontal distance to goal point (m)
        rta - (relative) required time of arrival (s)
        gsAccel - maximum ground speed acceleration or deceleration (positive, m/s^2)
        Returns:
        (gs,time) the goal ground speed and acceleration time needed in order to cover the given distance in the given time. Returns (-1,-1) if the rta is not attainable.

      • gsAccelToRTAV

        public static Pair<Triple<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>,Triple<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> gsAccelToRTAV(double gsIn,
                                                                                                                                                        double dist,
                                                                                                                                                        double rta,
                                                                                                                                                        double gsOut,
                                                                                                                                                        double gsAccel)
        This returns times and accelerations needed to reach an RTA at a given time with a given speed within a given distance.
        Parameters:
        gsIn - grounds speed in
        dist - distance to rta
        rta - time to rta
        gsOut - desired speed at rta
        gsAccel - maximum acceleration (positive value)
        Returns:
        a pair of triples: ((t1,t2,t3),(a1,gs2,a2)) t1 is the time for an initial acceleration leg with constant acceletation a1, starting immediately t2 is the time to be spent traveling at gs2 t3 is the time for a final acceleration leg with constant acceleration a2, ending at the rta On failure, returns all negative values

        public static Pair<Vect3,Velocity> vsLevelOutCalculation(Pair<Vect3,Velocity> sv0,
                                                         double targetAlt,
                                                         double a1,
                                                         double a2,
                                                         double t1,
                                                         double t2,
                                                         double t3,
                                                         double t)
        returns Pair that contains position and velocity at time t due to level out maneuver based on vsLevelOutTimesAD
        Parameters:
        sv0 - current position and velocity vectors
        climbRate - climb rate
        targetAlt - target altitude
        a1 - first acceleration
        a2 - second acceleration
        t1 - first time
        t2 - second time
        t3 - third time
        t - time point of interest
        Returns:
        position and velocity

      • vsLevelOut

        public static Pair<Vect3,Velocity> vsLevelOut(Pair<Vect3,Velocity> sv0,
                                              double t,
                                              double climbRate,
                                              double targetAlt,
                                              double accelUp,
                                              double accelDown,
                                              boolean allowClimbRateChange)
        returns Pair that contains position and velocity at time t due to level out maneuver
        Parameters:
        sv0 - current position and velocity vectors
        t - time point of interest
        climbRate - climb rate
        targetAlt - target altitude
        accelUp - first acceleration
        accelDown - second acceleration
        allowClimbRateChange - allows climbRate to change to initial velocity if it can help.
        Returns:
        position and velocity

                                                        double goalAlt,
                                                        double goalClimb,
                                                        double vsAccel)
        Experimental: return the position and velocity along a climb to level flight
        Parameters:
        s - initial position
        v - initial velocity
        t - time from start of climb
        goalAlt - goal altitude
        goalClimb - desired rate of climb (sign does not matter)
        vsAccel - acceleration during climb (sign does not matter)
        Returns:
        position and velocity

      • testLoSVs

        public static boolean testLoSVs(Vect3 so,
                                Velocity vo,
                                Velocity nvo,
                                Vect3 si,
                                Velocity vi,
                                double vsAccelOwn,
                                double stopTime,
                                double D,
                                double H)
        Test for LoS(D,H) between two aircraft when only ownship gs accelerates, compute trajectories up to time stopTime
        Parameters:
        so - initial position of ownship
        vo - initial velocity of ownship
        nvo - the target velocity of ownship (i.e. after turn maneuver complete)
        si - initial position of traffic
        vi - initial velocity of traffic
        vsAccelOwn - ground speed acceleration of the ownship
        stopTime - the duration of the turns
        D - horizontal distance
        H - vertical distance
        Returns:
        minimum distance data packed in a Vect4
